unnormalised: Okay, folks, let's talk film festivals! Ever been to one? They're like the ultimate Bollywood party, minus the crazy dance-offs (usually!). I’m talking about a concentrated dose of awesome films you probably wouldn’t find on Netflix, plus a whole lot of chai and samosas.
normalised: Okay, folks, let us talk film festivals! Ever been to one? They are like the ultimate Bollywood party, minus the crazy dance-offs (usually!). I am talking about a concentrated dose of awesome films you probably would not find on Netflix, plus a whole lot of chai and samosas.

unnormalised: Think of it as a mela, but instead of bangles and jhumkas, you’re buying into a vibe, a community of film lovers. From Cannes to Goa, these fests are popping up everywhere.
normalised: Think of it as a mela, but instead of bangles and jhumkas, you are buying into a vibe, a community of film lovers. From Cannes to Goa, these fests are popping up everywhere.

unnormalised: I remember going to the MAMI Mumbai Film Festival a couple of years back. Let me tell you, navigating the crowds near Prithvi Theatre in Juhu was a feat in itself. It was like trying to cross Dadar station during rush hour! But totally worth it.
normalised: I remember going to the M A M I Mumbai Film Festival a couple of years back. Let me tell you, navigating the crowds near Prithvi Theatre in Juhu was a feat in itself. It was like trying to cross Dadar station during rush hour! But totally worth it.

unnormalised: Seriously, you'll find everything from indie films about struggling artists in Kolkata to documentaries about the endangered snow leopards in Ladakh. Plus, you get to see Q&As with directors who probably poured their heart and soul (and possibly their entire bank balance!) into making these films. No Rs. 500 crore budget like a Rohit Shetty extravaganza here, but pure passion!
normalised: Seriously, you will find everything from indie films about struggling artists in Kolkata to documentaries about the endangered snow leopards in Ladakh. Plus, you get to see Q and A’s with directors who probably poured their heart and soul (and possibly their entire bank balance!) into making these films. No rupee five hundred crore budget like a Rohit Shetty extravaganza here, but pure passion!

unnormalised: And the best part? You might just stumble upon the next *Lagaan*. Or maybe just discover a super talented director before they blow up. It’s a great way to expand your film horizons beyond the usual masala fare.

unnormalised: So, if you're looking for something different, something real, something… cinematic… check out a film festival near you. The next Jio MAMI Mumbai Film Festival starts on 27 Oct 2024. Book your tickets in advance, because seats fill up faster than free golgappas at a wedding. Also, remember to keep snacks handy and be ready to travel at least 5 km for a parking spot. Trust me on that one!
